page.title: 08Old Warden Abbey.
page.content: To the North West of Old Warden lies Warden Abbey.It was built in 1135 by the Gastwick family.It was previously an abbey for the{Cistercian}monks from {Revaulx.}The actual house was built in 1537.It is now owned br Mr Samuel Whitbread who has leased it to Landmark Trust and it is now a holiday home. { }The abbey has been restored from an old,rundown,decaying building. The floors are linked by a spiral staircase.Nearly all of the brickwork is new,the only really old part of the building is the chimney.Outside the abbey is a stone coffin engraved with a sword.This coffin was found while restoration work was going on.
